abstract: Goldman Sachs chief Lloyd C. Blankfein said that multiyear, guaranteed pay contracts for bankers should be banned but also warned that overregulation could end up stifling the financial markets.
snippet: Goldman Sachs chief Lloyd C. Blankfein said that multiyear, guaranteed pay contracts for bankers should be banned but also warned that overregulation could end up stifling the financial markets.
lead_paragraph: Lloyd Blankfein, chief executive of the Wall Street firm Goldman Sachs, said Wednesday that multiyear, guaranteed pay contracts for bankers should be banned but also warned that overregulation could end up stifling the financial markets.
